text: Acleris arcticana is a species of moth of the family Tortricidae. It is found in Norway, Sweden, Finland,Fauna Europaea Greenland and North America, where it has been recorded from Ontario, Illinois and Wisconsin.mothphotographersgroup The wingspan is 14–24 mm. The forewings are very dark smoky grey with a faint oblique antemedian band, represented by a few dark scales near the costa. There are some scattered blackish scales in the apical portion. The hindwings are pale smoky, slightly speckled with black near the apex.McDunnough, J. 1934. The Canadian species of the Tortricid genus Peronea. Canadian Journal of Research, 1934, 11(3): 290-332 Adults are on wing from April to June and from August to September. The larvae feed on Salix glauca. ==References== Category:Moths described in 1845 arcticana Category:Moths of Europe Category:Moths of North America
title: Acleris arcticana
